com.bazaarvoice.bvandroidsdk

Class CurationsInfiniteRecyclerView

  • java.lang.Object
    • BVRecyclerView
      • com.bazaarvoice.bvandroidsdk.CurationsInfiniteRecyclerView

  • public class CurationsInfiniteRecyclerView
extends BVRecyclerView
    Helper View class to manage fetching and displaying a Grid of CurationsFeedItems

    Make sure to implement your own CurationsImageLoader to manage the fetching and displaying of images. We use this interface to be able to tie into whatever existing image fetching/caching/manipulating library you are already using.

    Example

    In your layout add

    
 <com.bazaarvoice.bvandroidsdk.CurationsInfiniteRecyclerView
  android:id="@+id/curations_recycler_view"
  android:layout_width="match_parent"
  android:layout_height="@dimen/curations_height"
  app:curationSpanCount="3"
  app:curationCellWidthRatio="4"
  app:curationCellHeightRatio="3"
  app:curationPageSize="20"
  app:curationOrientation="horizontal"/>

    In your android.app.Activity#onCreate(Bundle) after inflating your layout, add

    {@code
 final CurationsFeedRequest request = new CurationsFeedRequest
  .Builder(Arrays.asList("__foo__", "__bar__"))
  .build();
 curationsRecyclerView
  .setRequest(request)
  .setImageLoader(curationsImageLoader)
  .setOnPageLoadListener(new CurationsInfiniteRecyclerView.OnPageLoadListener() {

      • setMaxFeedItemCount

        public CurationsInfiniteRecyclerView setMaxFeedItemCount(int maxFeedItemCount)
        Optional field to increase the maximum number of CurationsFeedItems that this View will associate with the Adapter. Default is 360,430 which should be sufficient as is. Increasing this number, increases the amount of heap that is retained by the adapter.
        Parameters:
        maxFeedItemCount - Max number of items associated with Adapter
        Returns:
        this class
